description: From Ancient Greek ἀξιωμᾰτικός (axiōmatikós, “employing logical propositions”), from ἀξίωμα (axíōma, “self-evident principle”) +‎ -ικός (-ikós, “of or pertaining to, -ic”).

adjectives.description: axiomatic (comparative more axiomatic, superlative most axiomatic)

examples: It is axiomatic that the "physical entry of the home is the chief evil against which the wording of the Fourth Amendment is directed."

entries.meaning: (mathematics) Relating to or containing axioms. [from 19th c.]
